dialogue.text: Yo.
Please tell me you’re here for me. I’m bored as shit.
I was actually just about to text you begging you to come over.
I am here for you, Kirin.
Thank fucking God.
Noriko’s been blasting music for like two hours and I’m about to pour liquid cement into my ears.
I take it things aren’t going well in there?
Oh, things are actually really great. Just kind of annoying at times.
But it’s not like I can tell her to chill when it’s her room, too. She can do whatever she wants.
I’m sure there will be plenty of times where {i}she’ll{/i} get mad at me, so learning how to deal with that is a pretty logical first course of action.
Whatever the case, it sure beats staying at home.
Ramping up to complain about your sister again?
What do you mean, “ramping up?”
You make it sound like that’s a thing I do all the time.
I mean...not {i}all{/i} the time.
You’ve definitely made me aware of how much you hate living at home before, though.
But despite that, you still waited until you were put in my class to move into the dorms.
Why didn't you just bite the bullet and move into the other building?
Are you {i}trying{/i} to be a dick to me right now, or is this just happening on accident?
All I did was talk to you and now it’s like you’re fucking profiling me or something.
I didn’t mean it like that.
I’m obviously glad you’re here. I wouldn’t have come to see you if I wasn’t.
I just...also like your sister and wouldn’t feel right if I didn’t at least try to stand up for her.
Well...yeah...that makes sense.
Sorry for being so on edge or whatever. I shouldn’t have exploded like that.
It’s just weird, you know?
Even though I love it here, it’s still a huge frickin’ transition going from your parents’ house to living with some girl you literally just met.
Buuuuut...that’s enough emotional Kirin for now. Help me take my mind off of that stuff, Sensei.
I’m sure you didn’t just come over here to hear me complain.
If you want to complain, it’s fine-
I {i}said{/i}...I’m sure you didn’t come all the way here to hear me complain.
Take my fucking mind off stuff.
You can be really intimidating when you’re in a bad mood, Kirin.
You just need to learn how to deal with me. Don’t call me intimidating just because you haven’t figured it out yet.
Well, here’s hoping I’m actually able to do that one day.
If there’s anyone who can right now, it’s definitely you.
Because I’m the first boy you’ve ever had feelings for?
There’s a difference between “having feelings” and just wanting to hug somebody a whole bunch, you big jerk.
Anyway, have you been getting acclimated to life here apart from all of the Noriko stuff?
It must be a lot easier getting to[school] now, right?
I guess so, yeah.
Like, my parents’ house is far enough away for them to send buses and whatnot, but Karin and I never really took them.
Is it because Karin thinks it’s best to get exercise early in the morning to...set your body up for the rest of the day or something?
I don’t know, probably. That sounds like a thing she would say.
I just don’t really like buses. Or trains, really.
Or any small space with a lot of people, I guess.
People suck. Why would I ever want to be surrounded by them?
It also means that there’s probably someone in that group who’s going to think {i}I{/i} suck as well.
But you're so awesome and talented and your hair smells so nice.
But really, though. Fuck everybody.
Your attitude could use a little adjusting, though.
I thought growing platonically closer to you might fix that, but...
Well, hey. It’s definitely working, so it’s not like I can really bash you for it.
Right. You can just call me out on it and make me question my morals.
Not only does our platonic relationship have nothing to do with your morals, the moral compass you {i}do{/i} have is infallible and unbreaking.
I truly do wish more people could be like you.
Thanks, Kirin.
No problem, boy'o. Now brace yourself because I'm gonna hit you with a random question.
Do you...
Do you want to hug Ami?
Of course I want hug Ami. I want to hug everyone. And Ami is so soft and cute.
It's like hugging a large strawberry.
What kind of fruit do I remind you of, Sensei?
Kirin sighs and presses her back up against her door.
We talk for a short while after that, but the conversation loses steam and we ultimately wind up a little bored further down the line.
I think about inviting her out to walk around town or something, but it’s already getting really late and it would make more sense at this point to just go home.
In the end, we exchange goodbyes and head our separate ways.
I can hear another sigh from Kirin bleed into the sounds of rock music contaminating the hall once she opens the door.
Here’s hoping she can get some sleep tonight.
{i}Kirin’s affection has increased to [kirin_love]!{/i}
